meanings.definition: Not decadent or in a state of decline.
meanings.sent1: The simple meal was undecadent, consisting of plain rice and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The undecadent lifestyle of the villagers focused on hard work and community values.
meanings.sent3: Even the squirrels in the undecadent forest preferred nuts over fancy treats.
meanings.sent4: Her undecadent approach to fashion stood out in a sea of extravagant outfits.
meanings.sent5: The undecadent sunset painted the sky in soft hues of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: Not characterized by excessive luxury or self-indulgence.
meanings.sent1: The undecadent hotel room had simple furnishings and no frills.
meanings.sent2: She preferred undecadent gifts like books and homemade cookies over expensive jewelry.
meanings.sent3: The undecadent party featured homemade snacks and board games instead of lavish decorations.
meanings.sent4: His undecadent taste in music leaned towards folk songs and acoustic melodies.
meanings.sent5: The undecadent garden was filled with wildflowers and humble vegetable patches.

meanings.definition: Not showing signs of decay or deterioration.
meanings.sent1: The undecadent building stood strong against the test of time, its walls sturdy and intact.
meanings.sent2: The undecadent fruit remained fresh and juicy even after days on the counter.
meanings.sent3: In the undecadent cellar, the old wine bottles seemed to defy aging with each passing year.
meanings.sent4: Her undecadent skin glowed with health and vitality, untouched by wrinkles or blemishes.
meanings.sent5: The undecadent oak tree in the yard stood tall and proud, its leaves vibrant and green.
